intro: Sarcostoma javanicum, commonly known as the Java sarcostoma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
